question: sein
english: to be

question: haben
english: to have, to contain

question: werden
english: to become, will, to be done (passive voice)

question: können
english: can, to be able to

question: wollen
english: to want

question: müssen
english: must, to have to, to be obliged (to do something)
french: devoir, être obligé (de faire quelque chose)

question: sollen
english: shall, to be asked (to do something)
french: devoir, être invité (à faire quelque chose)

question: mögen
english: to like

question: dürfen
english: to be allowed (to do something), may
french: être autorisé (à faire quelque chose), peut

question: wissen
english: to know

question: machen
english: to make, to prepare (e.g. food), to do
french: faire, préparer (par exemple de la nourriture)

question: tun
english: to do, to do something to someone
french: faire, faire quelque chose à quelqu'un

question: sagen
english: to say, to tell

question: gehen
english: to go, to leave, to work, to function (coll.)

question: sehen
english: to see, to see (to something), to realise

question: geben
english: to give

question: kommen
english: to come, to make it (e.g. over something), to go to, to occur

question: glauben
english: to believe

question: reden
english: to talk

question: hören
english: to hear, to listen to

question: finden
english: to find

question: bleiben
english: to remain, to stay

question: brauchen
english: to need

question: lieben
english: to love

question: bringen
english: to bring, to take, to lead

question: stehen
english: to stand, to be, to appear

question: heißen
english: to be called, to mean

question: nehmen
english: to take, to cause oneself to be (in some state)

question: sprechen
english: to speak

question: bekommen
english: to receive, to catch (e.g. a cold), to sit well with someone
french: recevoir, attraper (par exemple un rhume), s'entendre avec quelqu'un

question: vergessen
english: to forget, to leave (forget to take)

question: halten
english: to hold, to stop (a movement), to support, to keep

question: warten
english: to wait, to maintain (e.g. a car)

question: kennen
english: to know, to be acquainted with, to be familiar with

question: verstehen
english: to understand, to get along with someone/something

question: denken
english: to think, to consider

question: leben
english: to live

question: arbeiten
english: to work

question: essen
english: to eat

question: bieten
english: to offer, to bid, to arise, to occur (of an opportunity) (refl.)
french: offrir, enchérir, surgir, se produire (d'une opportunité) (réfl.)

question: aufstehen
english: to get up, to be open (e.g. a window, door)
french: se lever, être ouvert (par exemple une fenêtre, une porte)

question: anziehen
english: to get dressed, to put on, to dress someone, to attract, to pull
french: s'habiller, mettre, habiller quelqu'un, attirer, tirer
